main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by military personnel at Elmendorf AFB, Alaska on 6 November 1954, exhibiting high speeds, erratic flight patterns, and maneuvers such as sudden 90-degree turns and altitudinal changes in excess of 20,000 feet in 8 to 10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as a luminous, white-colored object traveling at a high rate of speed in level flight and approximately the size of a basketball.
Ground observers at Elmendorf AFB witnessed the objects visually during the period of radar observation, describing them as red to orange in color and following extremely erratic flight patterns.

The objects were tracked by radar for approximately 15 minutes and were observed for around 10 minutes, moving at an estimated speed of 1800 to 2400 miles per hour at an average altitude of approximately 38,000 feet.
No known aircraft in the area at the time could account for the observed behavior and characteristics of the objects, prompting further investigation.
The reports of all involved personnel were forwarded to the Air Technical Intelligence Center for evaluation and analysis.
sighted object: unidentified aerial objects exhibiting erratic flight patterns and high speeds
witnesses: military personnel, including the Commanding Officer of the 57th Fighter Interceptor Squadron and the Base Operations Officer
